member.name: M:Raven.Database.Backup.DirectoryBackup.Execute
member.summary: The process for backing up a directory index is simple: a) create hard links to all the files in the lucene directory in a temp director that gives us the current snapshot, and protect us from lucene's deleting files. b) copy the hard links to the destination directory c) delete the temp directory

member.name: T:Raven.Database.Backup.RemoveBackupDocumentStartupTask
member.summary: Delete the backup status document, if it indicate a backup was in progress when the server crashed / shutdown we have to do that to enable the next backup to complete

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Indexing.DefaultBackgroundTaskExecuter.ExecuteAll``1(Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration,System.Threading.Tasks.TaskScheduler,System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Action{``0,System.Int64})

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractPutTrigger.AllowPut(System.String,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,Raven.Abstractions.Data.TransactionInformation)
member.summary: Ask the trigger whatever the PUT should be vetoed. If the trigger vote to veto the PUT, it needs to provide a human readable explanation why the PUT was rejected.
member.remarks: This method SHOULD NOT modify either the document or the metadata.
member.param: The new document about to be put into Raven
The current transaction, if it exists
member.returns: Whatever the put was vetoed or not

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractPutTrigger.OnPut(System.String,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,Raven.Abstractions.Data.TransactionInformation)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic just before the document is saved to disk. Any modifications the trigger makes to the document or the metadata will be persisted to disk.
member.remarks: If the trigger need to access the previous state of the document, the trigger should implement and use the provided instance to Get it. The returned result would be the old document (if it exists) or null. Any call to the provided instance will be done under the same transaction as the PUT operation.
member.param: The new document about to be put into Raven
The current transaction, if it exists

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractPutTrigger.AfterPut(System.String,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,System.Guid,Raven.Abstractions.Data.TransactionInformation)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic after the document was put but still in the same transaction as the put
member.remarks: Any call to the provided instance will be done under the same transaction as the PUT operation.
member.param: The new document about to be put into Raven
The etag of the just put document
The current transaction, if it exists

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractPutTrigger.AfterCommit(System.String,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,System.Guid)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic _after_ the transaction was committed. For example, by notifying interested parties.
member.remarks: This method SHOULD NOT modify either the document or the metadata
member.param: The document that was put into Raven
The etag of the just put document

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractDeleteTrigger.AllowDelete(System.String,Raven.Abstractions.Data.TransactionInformation)
member.summary: Ask the trigger whatever the DELETE should be vetoed. If the trigger vote to veto the DELETE, it needs to provide a human readable explanation why the DELETE was rejected.
member.remarks: This method SHOULD NOT modify either the document or the metadata.
member.returns: Whatever the put was vetoed or not

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractDeleteTrigger.OnDelete(System.String,Raven.Abstractions.Data.TransactionInformation)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic just before the document is deleted.
member.remarks: If the trigger need to access the previous state of the document, the trigger should implement and use the provided instance to Get it. The returned result would be the old document (if it exists) or null. Any call to the provided instance will be done under the same transaction as the DELETE operation.

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractDeleteTrigger.AfterDelete(System.String,Raven.Abstractions.Data.TransactionInformation)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic after the document was deleted but still in the same transaction as the delete. This method is called only if a row was actually deleted
member.remarks: Any call to the provided instance will be done under the same transaction as the DELETE operation.

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractDeleteTrigger.AfterCommit(System.String)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic _after_ the transaction was committed. For example, by notifying interested parties.

member.name: T:Raven.Database.Extensions.MonoHttpUtility
member.summary: We have to use this stupid trick because HttpUtility.UrlEncode / Decode uses HttpContext.Current under the covers, which doesn't work in IIS7 Application_Start

member.name: T:Raven.Database.Indexing.Collation.IndexableBinaryStringTools_UsingArrays
member.summary:
Provides support for converting byte sequences to Strings and back again. The resulting Strings preserve the original byte sequences' sort order.
The Strings are constructed using a Base 8000h encoding of the original binary data - each char of an encoded String represents a 15-bit chunk from the byte sequence. Base 8000h was chosen because it allows for all lower 15 bits of char to be used without restriction; the surrogate range [U+D8000-U+DFFF] does not represent valid chars, and would require complicated handling to avoid them and allow use of char's high bit.
Although unset bits are used as padding in the final char, the original byte sequence could contain trailing bytes with no set bits (null bytes): padding is indistinguishable from valid information. To overcome this problem, a char is appended, indicating the number of encoded bytes in the final content char.
This class's operations are defined over CharBuffers and ByteBuffers, to allow for wrapped arrays to be reused, reducing memory allocation costs for repeated operations. Note that this class calls array() and arrayOffset() on the CharBuffers and ByteBuffers it uses, so only wrapped arrays may be used. This class interprets the arrayOffset() and limit() values returned by its input buffers as beginning and end+1 positions on the wrapped array, resprectively; similarly, on the output buffer, arrayOffset() is the first position written to, and limit() is set to one past the final output array position.
member.remarks: Note that the reason we have this code here is that we don't want to convert to/from List / array which is the case of the same class in the Lucene code.

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Indexing.Collation.IndexableBinaryStringTools_UsingArrays.GetEncodedLength(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Byte})
member.summary: Returns the number of chars required to encode the given byte sequence.
member.param: The byte sequence to be encoded. Must be backed by an array.
member.returns: The number of chars required to encode the given byte sequence
member.throws: IllegalArgumentException If the given ByteBuffer is not backed by an array

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Indexing.Collation.IndexableBinaryStringTools_UsingArrays.GetDecodedLength(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns the number of bytes required to decode the given char sequence.
member.param: The char sequence to be encoded. Must be backed by an array.
member.returns: The number of bytes required to decode the given char sequence
member.throws: IllegalArgumentException If the given CharBuffer is not backed by an array

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Indexing.Collation.IndexableBinaryStringTools_UsingArrays.Encode(System.Byte[],System.Char[])
member.summary: Encodes the input byte sequence into the output char sequence. Before calling this method, ensure that the output CharBuffer has sufficient capacity by calling {@link #GetEncodedLength(java.nio.ByteBuffer)}.
member.param: Where the char sequence encoding result will go. The limit is set to one past the position of the final char.
member.throws: IllegalArgumentException If either the input or the output buffer
member.summary: is not backed by an array

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Indexing.Collation.IndexableBinaryStringTools_UsingArrays.Decode(System.Char[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decodes the input char sequence into the output byte sequence. Before calling this method, ensure that the output ByteBuffer has sufficient capacity by calling {@link #GetDecodedLength(java.nio.CharBuffer)}.
member.param: Where the byte sequence decoding result will go. The limit is set to one past the position of the final char.
member.throws: IllegalArgumentException If either the input or the output buffer
member.summary: is not backed by an array

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Indexing.Collation.IndexableBinaryStringTools_UsingArrays.Decode(System.Char[])
member.summary: Decodes the given char sequence, which must have been encoded by {@link #Encode(java.nio.ByteBuffer)} or {@link #Encode(java.nio.ByteBuffer, java.nio.CharBuffer)}.
member.returns: A byte sequence containing the decoding result. The limit is set to one past the position of the final char.
member.throws: IllegalArgumentException If the input buffer is not backed by an
member.summary: array

member.summary: The indexing scheduler to use

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.MaxNumberOfItemsToIndexInSingleBatch
member.summary: Max number of items to take for indexing in a batch Minimum: 128

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.InitialNumberOfItemsToIndexInSingleBatch
member.summary: The initial number of items to take when indexing a batch Default: 512 or 256 depending on CPU architecture

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.MaxNumberOfItemsToReduceInSingleBatch
member.summary: Max number of items to take for reducing in a batch Minimum: 128

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.InitialNumberOfItemsToReduceInSingleBatch
member.summary: The initial number of items to take when reducing a batch Default: 256 or 128 depending on CPU architecture

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.MaxNumberOfParallelIndexTasks
member.summary: The maximum number of indexing tasks allowed to run in parallel Default: The number of processors in the current machine

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.TempIndexPromotionThreshold
member.summary: Time (in milliseconds) the index has to be queried at least once in order for it to become permanent Default: 60000 (once per minute)

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.TempIndexPromotionMinimumQueryCount
member.summary: How many times a temporary, auto-generated index has to be accessed before it can be promoted to be a permanent one Default: 100

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.TempIndexCleanupPeriod
member.summary: How often to run the temporary index cleanup process (in seconds) Default: 600 (10 minutes)

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.TempIndexCleanupThreshold
member.summary: How much time in seconds to wait after a temporary index has been used before removing it if no further calls were made to it during that time Default: 1200 (20 minutes)

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.TempIndexInMemoryMaxBytes
member.summary: Temp indexes are kept in memory until they reach this integer value in bytes Default: 25 MB Minimum: 1 MB

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.HostName
member.summary: The hostname to use when creating the http listener (null to accept any hostname or address) Default: none, binds to all host names

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.Port
member.summary: The port to use when creating the http listener. Default: 8080. You can set it to *, in which case it will find the first available port from 8080 and upward.

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.AccessControlAllowOrigin
member.summary: Determine the value of the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header sent by the server. Indicates the URL of a site trusted to make cross-domain requests to this server. Allowed values: null (don't send the header), *, http://example.org (space separated if multiple sites)

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.AccessControlMaxAge
member.summary: Determine the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age header sent by the server. Indicates how long (seconds) the browser should cache the Access Control settings. Ignored if AccessControlAllowOrigin is not specified. Default: 1728000 (20 days)

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.AccessControlAllowMethods
member.summary: Determine the value of the Access-Control-Allow-Methods header sent by the server. Indicates which HTTP methods (verbs) are permitted for requests from allowed cross-domain origins. Ignored if AccessControlAllowOrigin is not specified. Default: PUT,PATCH,GET,DELETE,POST

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.AccessControlRequestHeaders
member.summary: Determine the value of the Access-Control-Request-Headers header sent by the server. Indicates which HTTP headers are permitted for requests from allowed cross-domain origins. Ignored if AccessControlAllowOrigin is not specified. Allowed values: null (allow whatever headers are being requested), HTTP header field name

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.VirtualDirectory
member.summary: The virtual directory to use when creating the http listener. Default: /

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.HttpCompression
P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.AnonymousUserAccessMode
member.summary: Defines which operations are allowed for anonymous users. Allowed values: All, Get, None Default: Get

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.AuthenticationMode
member.summary: Defines which mode to use to authenticate requests Allowed values: Windows, OAuth Default: Windows

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.AllowLocalAccessWithoutAuthorization
member.summary: If set local request don't require authentication Allowed values: true/false Default: false

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.OAuthTokenCertificate
member.summary: The certificate to use when verifying access token signatures for OAuth

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.DataDirectory
member.summary: The directory for the RavenDB database. You can use the ~\ prefix to refer to RavenDB's base directory. Default: ~\Data

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.DefaultStorageTypeName
member.summary: What storage type to use (see: RavenDB Storage engines) Allowed values: esent, munin Default: esent

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.RunInMemory
member.summary: Should RavenDB's storage be in-memory. If set to true, Munin would be used as the storage engine, regardless of what was specified for StorageTypeName Allowed values: true/false Default: false

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.TransactionMode
member.summary: What sort of transaction mode to use. Allowed values: Lazy - faster, but can result in data loss in the case of server crash. Safe - slower, but will never lose data Default: Safe

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.WebDir
member.summary: The directory to search for RavenDB's WebUI. This is usually only useful if you are debugging RavenDB's WebUI. Default: ~/Raven/WebUI

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.PluginsDirectory
member.summary: Where to look for plugins for RavenDB. Default: ~\Plugins

member.name: P:Raven.Database.Config.InMemoryRavenConfiguration.MemoryCacheExpiration
member.summary: The expiration value for documents in the internal managed cache

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractAttachmentDeleteTrigger.AllowDelete(System.String)
member.summary: Ask the trigger whatever the DELETE should be vetoed. If the trigger vote to veto the DELETE, it needs to provide a human readable explanation why the DELETE was rejected.
member.remarks: This method SHOULD NOT modify either the attachment or the metadata.
member.returns: Whatever the put was vetoed or not

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractAttachmentDeleteTrigger.OnDelete(System.String)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic just before the attachment is deleted.
member.remarks: If the trigger need to access the previous state of the attachment, the trigger should implement and use the provided instance to Get it. The returned result would be the old document (if it exists) or null. Any call to the provided instance will be done under the same transaction as the DELETE operation.

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractAttachmentDeleteTrigger.AfterDelete(System.String)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic after the attachment was deleted but still in the same transaction as the delete. This method is called only if a row was actually deleted
member.remarks: Any call to the provided instance will be done under the same transaction as the DELETE operation.

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractAttachmentDeleteTrigger.AfterCommit(System.String)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic _after_ the transaction was committed. For example, by notifying interested parties.

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractAttachmentPutTrigger.AllowPut(System.String,System.IO.Stream,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject)
member.summary: Ask the trigger whatever the PUT should be vetoed. If the trigger vote to veto the PUT, it needs to provide a human readable explanation why the PUT was rejected.
member.remarks: This method SHOULD NOT modify either the document or the metadata.
member.param: The new attachment data about to be put into Raven
member.returns: Whatever the put was vetoed or not

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractAttachmentPutTrigger.OnPut(System.String,System.IO.Stream,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic just before the document is saved to disk. Any modifications the trigger makes to the document or the metadata will be persisted to disk.
member.remarks: If the trigger need to access the previous state of the document, the trigger should implement and use the provided instance to Get it. The returned result would be the old document (if it exists) or null. Any call to the provided instance will be done under the same transaction as the PUT operation.
member.param: The new attachment data about to be put into Raven

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractAttachmentPutTrigger.AfterPut(System.String,System.IO.Stream,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,System.Guid)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic after the document was put but still in the same transaction as the put
member.remarks: Any call to the provided instance will be done under the same transaction as the PUT operation.
member.param: The new attachment data about to be put into Raven
The etag of the just put document

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractAttachmentPutTrigger.AfterCommit(System.String,System.IO.Stream,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,System.Guid)
member.summary: Allow the trigger to perform any logic _after_ the transaction was committed. For example, by notifying interested parties.
member.remarks: This method SHOULD NOT modify either the document or the metadata
member.param: The attachment data that was put into Raven
The etag of the just put document

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractAttachmentReadTrigger.AllowRead(System.String,System.IO.Stream,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,Raven.Database.Plugins.ReadOperation)
member.summary: Ask the trigger whatever the document should be read by the user.
member.remarks: The document and metadata instances SHOULD NOT be modified.
member.param: The key of the read document - can be null if reading a projection
Whatever the operation is a load or a query
member.returns: * If the result is Allow, the operation continues as usual. * If the result is Deny, the operation will return an error to the user if asking for a particular document, or an error document in place of the result if asking for a query. * If the result is Ignore, the operation will return null to the user if asking for a particular document, or skip including the result entirely in the query results.

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractAttachmentReadTrigger.OnRead(System.String,Raven.Abstractions.Data.Attachment)
member.summary: Allow the trigger the option of modifying the document and metadata instances before the user can see them.
member.remarks: The modified values are transient, and are NOT saved to the database.

member.name: T:Raven.Database.Linq.GroupByKeyFunc
member.summary: Get the group by value from the document

member.name: T:Raven.Database.Linq.TranslatorFunc
member.summary: Defining the translator function for a set of results about to sent to the user and apply final processing

member.name: T:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractReadTrigger
member.summary: * Read triggers may be called on projections from indexes, not just documents

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractReadTrigger.AllowRead(System.String,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,Raven.Database.Plugins.ReadOperation,Raven.Abstractions.Data.TransactionInformation)
member.summary: Ask the trigger whatever the document should be read by the user.
member.remarks: The document and metadata instances SHOULD NOT be modified.
member.param: The key of the read document - can be null if reading a projection
Whatever the operation is a load or a query
member.returns: * If the result is Allow, the operation continues as usual. * If the result is Deny, the operation will return an error to the user if asking for a particular document, or an error document in place of the result if asking for a query. * If the result is Ignore, the operation will return null to the user if asking for a particular document, or skip including the result entirely in the query results.

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractReadTrigger.OnRead(System.String,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,Raven.Json.Linq.RavenJObject,Raven.Database.Plugins.ReadOperation,Raven.Abstractions.Data.TransactionInformation)
member.summary: Allow the trigger the option of modifying the document and metadata instances before the user can see them.
member.remarks: The modified values are transient, and are NOT saved to the database.
member.param: The key of the read document - can be null if reading a projection
Whatever the operation is a load or a query

member.name: T:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractIndexUpdateTrigger
member.summary: Implementers of this class are called whenever an index entry is created / deleted. Work shouldn't be done by the methods of this interface, rather, they should be done in a background thread. Communication between threads can use either in memory data structure or the persistent (and transactional ) queue implementation available on the transactional storage.
member.remarks: * All operations are delete/create operations, whatever the value previously existed or not. * It is possible for OnIndexEntryDeleted to be called for non existent values. * It is possible for a single entry key to be called inserted several times entry keys are NOT unique.

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractIndexUpdateTriggerBatcher.OnIndexEntryDeleted(System.String)
member.summary: Notify that a document with the specified key was deleted Key may represent a missing document

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractIndexUpdateTriggerBatcher.OnIndexEntryCreated(System.String,Lucene.Net.Documents.Document)
member.summary: Notify that the specified document with the specified key is about to be inserted.
member.remarks: You may modify the provided lucene document, changes made to the document will be written to the Lucene index
member.param: The lucene document about to be written

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Plugins.AbstractIndexUpdateTriggerBatcher.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.summary: This is a thread safe, single instance for a particular index.

member.summary: Whatever this is a map reduce index or not

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Indexing.QueryBuilder.PreProcessUntokenizedTerms(System.String,Raven.Database.Indexing.RangeQueryParser)
member.summary: Detects untokenized fields and sets as NotAnalyzed in analyzer

member.name: F:Raven.Database.DocumentDatabase.putSerialLock
member.summary: This is required to ensure serial generation of etags during puts

member.name: M:Raven.Database.DocumentDatabase.DisableAllTriggersForCurrentThread
member.summary: This API is provided solely for the use of bundles that might need to run without any other bundle interfering. Specifically, the replication bundle need to be able to run without interference from any other bundle.

member.name: M:Raven.Database.DocumentDatabase.GetTotalSizeOnDisk
member.summary: Get the total size taken by the database on the disk. This explicitly does NOT include in memory indexes or in memory database. It does include any reserved space on the file system, which may significantly increase the database size.
member.remarks: This is a potentially a very expensive call, avoid making it if possible.

member.name: P:Raven.Database.DocumentDatabase.Name
member.summary: The name of the database. Defaults to null for the root database (or embedded database), or the name of the database if this db is a tenant database

member.name: P:Raven.Database.DocumentDatabase.ExtensionsState
member.summary: This is used to hold state associated with this instance by external extensions

member.name: P:Raven.Database.DocumentDatabase.Disposed
member.summary: Whatever this database has been disposed

member.name: M:Raven.Database.Indexing.AnonymousObjectToLuceneDocumentConverter.CreateFields(System.String,System.Object,Lucene.Net.Documents.Field.Store,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method generate the fields for indexing documents in lucene from the values. Given a name and a value, it has the following behavior: * If the value is enumerable, index all the items in the enumerable under the same field name * If the value is null, create a single field with the supplied name with the unanalyzed value 'NULL_VALUE' * If the value is string or was set to not analyzed, create a single field with the supplied name * If the value is date, create a single field with millisecond precision with the supplied name * If the value is numeric (int, long, double, decimal, or float) will create two fields: 1. with the supplied name, containing the numeric value as an unanalyzed string - useful for direct queries 2. with the name: name +'_Range', containing the numeric value in a form that allows range queries

member.name: T:Raven.Database.Linq.AbstractViewGenerator
member.summary: This class represents a base class for all "Views" we generate and compile on the fly - all Map and MapReduce indexes are being re-written into this class and then compiled and executed against the data in RavenDB

member.name: T:Raven.Database.Linq.DynamicViewCompiler
member.summary: Takes two query expressions as strings, and compile them. Along the way we apply some minimal transformations, the end result is an instance of AbstractViewGenerator, representing the map/reduce functions

member.name: T:Raven.Database.Linq.IndexingFunc
member.summary: Defining the indexing function for a set of documents

member.summary: These methods allow the indexes to use Linq query syntax using dynamic
